intro: Racosperma centrinervium, commonly known as the narrow-veined acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or pale green, and it plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat. Racosperma centrinervium is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance.
